intro: Cyrtandra macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf cyrtandra, is a tropical plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the Hawaiian Islands and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are usually pale green to white, with five petals and a distinctive, spurred shape. Cyrtandra macrophylla is often found in wetlands and streamside habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
